document.masterDocTitle: New subgenera and species of Agraeciini (Orthoptera, Tettigoniidae, Conocephalinae) from South Asia found in historical insect collections

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New subgenera and species of Agraeciini (Orthoptera, Tettigoniidae, Conocephalinae) from South Asia found in historical insect collections

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Zoologisches Forschungsmuseum Alexander Koenig, Adenauerallee 160, D- 53113 Bonn, Germany.

figureCitation.captionText: Figure 5. Liara (Indoliara) dividata sp. nov. A-G male holotype: A habitus dorsal view; B face; C stridulatory file; D abdominal apex with cerci in ventro-apical view; E titillators of male phallus; F tip of titillators; G subgenital plate. - H-K female: H habitus lateral view; I head in dorsal view; J thoracic sternites; K subgenital plate.

subSubSection.paragraph: (male). India: South India, Thekkadi, Periyar Dam ( 9째35'N , 77째9'E ), 6.-10.v.1937, coll. B.M.-C.M. Expedition to South India - depository: BMNH (Lo032S001; B.M.1939-205).
(1 female). India: South India, Travancore, Pirmed ( 9째40'N , 76째59'E ), elev. 1036 m, 4.-6.v.1933, coll. B.M.-C.M. Expedition to South India - BMNH (Lo032S002; B.M.1939-205).
The name of the new species refers to the shape of the fastigium verticis that is divided into two short apical cones; from Latin dividere to divide.

This is the so far only species in the subgenus. Its differences to the species of the other subgenera of
Liara
are discussed above under Indoliara subgen. nov.

Female. Tenth abdominal tergite with apical margin concave in middle. Epiproct triangular, with shallow dorsal groove. Cerci conical, apex slightly curved mediad. Subgenital plate wider than long, roughly triangular with apex roundly excised. Ovipositor compressed blade-shaped, highest in middle.

Body w/wings: male 36, female 42; body w/o wings: male 36, female 44; pronotum: male 7.5, female 9.5; tegmen: male 25, female 26.5; hind femur: male 16, female 19.5; ovipositor: female 28 mm long, greatest height 3.2 mm.
